about.title: A Unique Space in the World
about.subtitle: DARte is the first and only museum in the world specifically dedicated to organ donation education, located in the heart of Hermosillo, Sonora.
about.whatIsDesc: DARte is an innovative educational space that combines science, culture, and hope. Our goal is to raise awareness and educate society about the vital importance of organ donation, transforming lives through knowledge.

miika.title: Donating Hope
miika.subtitle: The Miika Foundation is the heart of DARte, providing comprehensive and transformative support to patients and families on their journey toward organ transplantation.
miika.description: The Miika Foundation was born from the commitment to transform lives through organ donation. We work on every aspect of the transplant process to ensure our patients and families receive the support they need.

directAction.title: Direct Action
directAction.p1: When you register as a donor, you directly contribute to the life-saving network. Every potential donor is a spark of hope for thousands of people on the waiting list.
directAction.p2: Visiting the museum allows you to experience firsthand how donation transforms communities, and then you can share that experience with your network.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: We answer your questions about the museum, organ donation, and Miika Foundation.

questions.q: What is the museum admission fee?
questions.a: Access to DARte is free for educational purposes. Contact us for information about group tours or special events.
Monday to Friday: 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM | Saturdays: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM | Sundays: Closed. For special events, contact us.

questions.q: How do I get to the museum?
questions.a: We are located at Angela Peralta 35, Col. Periodista, Hermosillo, Sonora. We have parking and accessibility for people with disabilities.

questions.q: Can I bring my school group?
questions.a: Yes, we offer special tours and educational programs for schools. Contact us in advance to organize your visit.

questions.q: At what age can you become a donor?
questions.a: You can register from age 18. However, minors can be donors with parental consent.

questions.q: What are the types of donation?
questions.a: There are two types: organ donation (after death) and living donation (kidney or liver lobe).
Your registration is valid for life, but you can revoke your decision at any time.
No. The body is treated with the utmost respect during the donation process. Funeral arrangements are not affected.

questions.q: If I'm a donor, will I receive the same medical care?
questions.a: Yes. Donors receive exactly the same quality of care as any other patient. Your decision is private.

questions.q: How can Miika Foundation help my family?
questions.a: We offer comprehensive medical, psychological, and financial support during the transplant process. Contact us for a consultation.

questions.q: What expenses does the Foundation cover?
questions.a: We cover medical costs, transportation, accommodation, and other expenses associated with transplantation not covered by health services.

questions.q: How do I register with Miika Foundation?
questions.a: Call us at our contact number or visit our offices. We'll help you understand all the benefits available to you.

questions.q: How can I volunteer at DARte?
questions.a: Contact us through the contact form. We are looking for people passionate about organ donation.

questions.q: What requirements do I need to meet?
questions.a: You need to be over 18 years old, be enthusiastic, and have availability. We offer complete training.
Volunteering is an act of love and service. It is not paid, but it is invaluable to the community.

faq.helpText: Contact us directly. Our team is available to answer your specific questions.
